summary: This function takes a 2D array, converts its indices into a set (removing duplicates), and then maps the original array using only unique indices. It's unclear if it works for n-dimensional arrays.

details.comment: This function takes a 2D array, converts its indices into a set (removing duplicates), and then maps the original array using only unique indices. It's unclear if it works for n-dimensional arrays.
details.content:
def reHash(Grid):
    # this is for 2d arrays.
    # not sure about n-d arrays.
    Grid1=list(set([Grid.index(x) for x in Grid]))
    return [Grid[x] for x in Grid1]
